content.webTitle: Film picks: Kiss Kiss Bang Bang | The Getaway | Sunflower

fields.headline: Film picks
fields.bodyText: Kiss Kiss Bang Bang 7.05pm, Sky Movies Action Thriller (Shane Black, 2005) A trio of characters - Robert Downey Jr's Hollywood neophyte Harry Lockhart; Michelle Monaghan's struggling actress, Harmony; and Val Kilmer's petulant private dick, "Gay" Perry are thrown together in a noirish, Tarantinoesque, highly cine-literate LA-set thriller concerning the mysterious death of Harmony's sister: fast, violent, and packed with great one-liners. The Getaway 11.25pm, TCM (Sam Peckinpah, 1972) Steve McQueen's Doc, just out of jail, teams up with wife Ali MacGraw to recover the loot, pursued by cops, the mob and sadistic hitman Al Lettieri: can he blast his way to safety in Peckinpah's redemptive Mexico? Moving through a sunbaked landscape McQueen is all icy poise, the gunfights are stunning, the whole thing lean and hard as Jim Thompson's novel. Sunflower 1.20am, Film4 (Zhang Yang, 2005) Zhang's drama focuses on an awkward father-son relationship, but is as much about 30 years of socio-political change in China. It's a poignant tale, with Haiying Sun as the curmudgeonly painter who emerges from a labour camp to insist on realising his ambitions vicariously through his son (who is played at different ages by three actors). It's photographed by Jong Lin, a former collaborator of Ang Lee.
